MercyCorps cropland area¶

MercyCorps croplands impacted by locust¶

MercyCorps demand¶

The aim of this module is to extract the demand table. The prediction of current demand is based on demand in 2000 and population values from 2014-2020.

Created on Fri Jul 17 10:59:01 2020

@author: linnea.evanson@accenture.com

class my_package.demand.DemandTable(path_in='data/input/', path_out='data/output/')¶

This class creates the 2020 demand table.

create_demand_table()¶

Create the demand table by filtering input files, creating locationIDs, FactIDs, DateIDs, and predictions for consumption per region for the years 2014-2020.

Returns

demand_final: the final dataframe, with a value for consumption for each year.

create_locationIDs(frames)¶

Map locations within countries to their location ID and insert locationID column.

Parameters

frames – the dataframe of all filtered and concatenated input files.

Returns

the dataframe with additional column locationID.

filter_input_tables()¶

Filter for desired columns.

Returns

filtered, concatenated table from the 6 input files

func(x, r, initial)¶

The exponential growth function used to predict consumption and population growth.

Parameters

  • x – the year for which we want a prediction.

  • r – the growth rate.

  • initial – the initial value of consumption

Returns

The consumption after x years.

get_consumption_preds(frames)¶

Predict consumption in 2014-2020 based on population values from the same period, and consumption in 2000 as the initial value

Parameters

frames – the current dataframe with all locations and consumption types.

:returns the consumption predictions for 2014-2020 per region and an updated dataframe with no null values.

split_locationID(locationID)¶

Splits the locationID into its country, area, district, and region components.

Parameters

locationID – the locationID for one row.

:returns country, area, district, and region strings.

sum_regions(filename)¶

Function to sum population of all districts within a region.

Parameters

filename – name of the file containing population data down to district level for all

regions in all countries of interest for a particular year. :return the sum of the population on a region level and the locationIDs for those regions.

This class crosses the results between the 2 methods, based on geolocations and location shapefiles.

A geodataframe with all districts of the 4 countries concatenated.

class my_package.location_mapping.ExtractCoordinates(path_in='s3://mercy-locust-covid19-in-dev/inbound/sourcedata/', path_out='s3://mercy-locust-covid19-out-dev/')¶
